categories.title: Main Questions
categories.description: This test includes all 20 questions from the Main Compatibility Pack, with 3 response options each to reveal emotional and relational patterns.

questions.text: When you're in a relationship, what does 'peace' look like to you?

options.text: I feel safe, soft, and deeply understood.
No drama and fun vibes — we just vibe.
No pressure or rules. I want full freedom.

questions.text: If your partner asked you to open up about your past — every relationship, mistake, and moment you’re ashamed of — how would you respond?

options.text: I’d tell him everything. No masks.
I’d tell some, but not all. He doesn’t need to know everything.
I avoid that — it’s none of his business.

questions.text: When you're emotionally triggered by something your partner says or does, what’s your default reaction?

options.text: I breathe and communicate calmly.
I withdraw or sulk until he asks what’s wrong.
I go cold, angry, or react fast.

questions.text: What makes a man 'worthy' of your submission, softness, and loyalty?

options.text: His leadership, emotional presence, and consistency.
Chemistry and how he treats me short-term.
Nothing — I don’t submit.

questions.text: How do you respond when someone confronts you about something you did wrong — gently, but honestly?

options.text: I thank them and reflect immediately.
I get a bit defensive, but process it later.
I argue back or deflect blame.

questions.text: How many times have you truly given your heart to someone — with full honesty, vulnerability, and loyalty?

options.text: Once or twice — and I meant it fully.
A few times — but I held back parts of me.
I don't believe in full emotional exposure.

questions.text: How do you personally define loyalty in a relationship?

options.text: Emotional + sexual exclusivity, full transparency.
No cheating, but I still keep some privacy.
As long as I come back home, I’m loyal.

questions.text: If your partner asked you to cut off male friends who have flirted with you before, how would you react?

options.text: I’d do it without hesitation — respect first.
I’d explain they’re just friends, but limit contact.
No man tells me who I can or can't talk to.

questions.text: Are you open to submitting to a man who leads with love, strength, and purpose?

options.text: Yes — it makes me feel safe and feminine.
It depends how strong the bond is.
No — I lead myself.

questions.text: How do you usually express love physically?

options.text: Through touch, softness, and attentive care.
I show it when I feel in the mood.
I prefer emotional or mental connection.

questions.text: What’s your relationship with your father like?

options.text: Loving, respectful, and consistent.
Complicated — ups and downs.
Distant, painful, or absent.

questions.text: Would you be open to adapting your lifestyle to match your partner’s faith or culture?

options.text: Yes — if I love him, I’ll honor his values.
Possibly — if it doesn’t change who I am.
No — I won’t change for anyone.

questions.text: How do you feel about sexual exploration (kinks, domination, toys, power dynamics, etc.) with someone you trust?

options.text: Very open — I love exploring with my man.
I’m curious but have limits.
That’s not for me — I like to keep it simple.

questions.text: Be real — what’s your view on body count and how it affects relationships?

options.text: It matters — fewer bonds = more purity of love.
It depends on the person’s growth.
It’s irrelevant — past is past.

questions.text: What does “home” mean to you in a relationship?

options.text: Safety, routine, warmth, and care.
Shared experiences and excitement.
No attachment — I’m my own home.

questions.text: How would you describe your social energy?

options.text: Mostly private, intimate circles only.
Socially open but need space often.
Very outgoing — I need attention often.

questions.text: How do you react when you don’t feel desired by your partner?

options.text: I express it with love and ask how we can reconnect.
I pull away emotionally until he notices.
I seek attention elsewhere — emotionally or physically.

questions.text: Do you think jealousy is healthy in a relationship?

options.text: A little — it shows care and boundaries.
Only if it’s balanced and rare.
No — it’s toxic and controlling.

questions.text: When you start feeling deep love for someone, what scares you the most?

options.text: Losing them or not being enough.
Losing my freedom or identity.
Being controlled, vulnerable, or too soft.

questions.text: What does being 'a good woman' mean to you — beyond career or looks?

options.text: Kind, loyal, nurturing, emotionally wise.
Fun, ambitious, open-minded.
Fierce, dominant, independent.
